programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a coffin inside a storage unit in Chicago and hope it does not contain any unpleasant surprises. They also find a collection of toxic grenades.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders take on wealthy opponents at an Ontario auction, where they find a remote-controlled model of a Viper FanJet aircraft and a 1920s field camera.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit a country town with a thriving art scene, and Victor competes to buy an antique train set.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Carrollton, where the lots up for auction include hunting gear and glass-blowing equipment.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to restore a 1920s Haunted House car with the help of Ted and new painter Niko. The vehicle was damaged during Hurricane Sandy.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to turn a mini-version of a 1962 Corvette into a powerful convertible, before restoring a 1950s coin-operated children's ride.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy's normal hunting grounds are disrupted by boat traffic, forcing him to brave a treacherous stretch of swampland.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: A snapping turtle attacks members of the congregation at a baptism, and the Turtle Team is called to a college fraternity house to clean up a host of critters.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: The team tries to catch a beaver whose dam has flooded a nearby farm, and Turtleman comes face to face with his least favourite animal - the skunk.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War drum is brought into the shop, as well as an 1834 book with the original rules of baseball, and a customer brings in a 1970s skateboard.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets a visit from The Boss when a Bruce Springsteen tour jacket rocks into the store. Meanwhile, Corey checks out some motorcycle art.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about captured aliens, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files held in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1, suggesting that US government cover-ups occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy hires bodyguards to keep order at an auction, and Paul tries to stop Bogart from quitting.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Patrick Pecker fills in for Don at the auction in Western Road, and Cindy tries to take advantage of the change.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick through the junk at an airport and are tempted by vintage pedal cars. However, they find the owner will not part with them easily.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Carrollton, where the lots up for auction include hunting gear and glass-blowing equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit a country town with a thriving art scene, and Victor competes to buy an antique train set.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor manages to turn Bubba against Ricky at an auction in a wealthy suburb of Dallas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders have a mysterious new rival at an auction in the historical town of DeSoto, where a collection of Willie Nelson memorabilia is up for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The team visits an auction in Irving, where Victor buys a secret agent's locker and Bubba tries to sell some explicit art.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1939 Superman doll, while Corey has a jam on a 1952 Fender Telecaster.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Rolling Stones record spins into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether it meets Rick's satisfaction.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A banner from the secret WWII airborne division The Flying Tigers flies into the shop. Plus, Chum gets his hands on a 1980s Ooze-it toy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A suit worn by the Godfather of Soul, James Brown, dances its way into the store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum check out a water-propelled jetpack and a statue of the Hindu god Shiva is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rescue buoy from the set of Baywatch signed by David Hasselhoff is brought in, as well as two flintlock blunderbuss pistols. Rick and Corey check out a six-person solar bike.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War drum is brought into the shop, as well as an 1834 book with the original rules of baseball, and a customer brings in a 1970s skateboard.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets a visit from The Boss when a Bruce Springsteen tour jacket rocks into the store. Meanwhile, Corey checks out some motorcycle art.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a bass guitar signed by Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones and The Who's John Entwistle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a rare 1589 manual for war practices and fortifying defences after it is brought into his store.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Ghostly Regulars At Haunted Pubs & More
programme.desc: Take a creepy look at the spirits haunting Britain's pubs, as well as a mystery monster seen swimming in the Thames.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate reported sightings of strange flying objects and mysterious lights in the sky, questioning whether they could be signs of extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: The team unearths evidence of a secret tunnel while new clues suggest a deeper mystery than just the missing Confederate gold.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Two deals are on the line as the team races to get a classic Dodge Viper car from the Dominican Republic and an Apache speedboat from the local marina.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Lucy goes on a wild night out in London with TV personality Alan Carr, while back in Hebden Bridge, Jon spends the night with his best friend, Matt Forde.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The series reaches its majestic climax. Who will win Greg Davies's coveted golden head to become just the seventh Taskmaster Champion in history?.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Jo Caulfield joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Jimmy Carr, writer Steven Moffat and singer Rochelle Humes to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include sandy beaches, other people's opinions and being Scottish.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by games expert Ellie Gibson, with Harry Potter stars James and Oliver Phelps.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Comedienne Helen Thorn joins Ellie Gibson, Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon to submit her favourite video game for approval in Ellie's hallowed Hall of Game.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim have two wheelie bins full of junk and just three days to create a spectacular moment with a pro athlete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick samples a fried chicken breakfast in Soho with comedian Lloyd Griffith, before heading to his favourite ramen bar, Bone Daddies.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick samples a vegan street food platter with Rhod Gilbert, before visiting a Willy Wonka style sweet shop.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around Â£2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A highly strung collector turns out to be a handful for the guys, while Danielle goes to New York City for an auction of rock-legend memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys try to move a 1929 Roadster safely down a decaying 100-year-old elevator.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Dustin continues to pose a threat to Brandon and Lori in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori is angry when Brandon cuts a deal with rival Jesse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are unsure of how to react when Jesse's bidding becomes aggressive.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A monster scares the bidders, while Brandon and Lori bet big on a DJ's equipment.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: The work of the men and women who protect Ireland's borders on a daily basis, capturing the frontline work of the numerous agencies at multiple locations around the country.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Officer James O'Hearne has to deal with a passenger who has no passport and no form of identification, while a Chinese lady who has just arrived from Toronto faces being deported.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Turin, Italy, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary, Mel Giedroyc, Josh Widdicombe and Matt Dawson join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton return for the domestic comedy, which sees the couple continuing to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In the first episode, Geoffrey reluctantly allows Lee to help Lucy clear up the builder's mess in their new kitchen extension. With Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy arranges a special surprise for Lee's birthday, which sees their family and friends joining them in a Crystal Maze-style physical adventure game where the objective is to escape from a series of rooms. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan, Tessa Coates, Charlie Brooker and Shappi Khorsandi are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Sausage Party (2016)
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave reveals the secrets of how television is made, and examines the nature of happiness with the help of Kate Middleton's clothes and Thomas the Tank Engine.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Using the latest technology, divers explore the remains of the troop-carrier SS Leopoldville. The ship was torpedoed in the English Channel on Christmas Eve 1944, resulting in the deaths of almost 800 American soldiers. Narrated by Russell Boulter.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The search for traces of British warship HMS Curacoa, which collided with the Queen Mary and sank 50 miles off the Irish coast in 1942. The vessel was escorting the liner, which was carrying 20,000 American troops, to the Clyde when the accident occurred, though a news blackout subsequently obscured details of the incident.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, goes behind closed doors to reveal the private lives of six historical figures, beginning with Princess Margaret. Dr Borman discovers the real reason Margaret's relationship with RAF officer Peter Townsend came to an end, uncovers her disastrous marriage to Antony Snowden and discovers more about her love of music and devotion to duty.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, explores Edward VIII's childhood with his overbearing father, reveals how the First World War saw him grow up in more ways than one, and explores his apparent desire for married women. She also uncovers the truth about Edward's abdication of the throne, and Wallis Simpson's infidelity, and reveals how Edward was a fashion icon of the day, examining his clothes in Kensington Palace.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: An unprecedented insight into the Royals and the armed services that fight in their name, from the early 20th century to modern-day conflicts such as Afghanistan. The first episode focuses on Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George is aggrieved to learn his father has cancer, and Nick saves a boy's life, but hurts himself in the process. Meanwhile, Bayleaf finds himself up in front of the magistrate.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: Feature-length drama in which the Middle Ages' answer to Sherlock Holmes sets out to investigate a slave girl's disappearance and locate a treasured relic missing from his abbey. Unfortunately, no sooner has he begun searching for a connection than a dead body turns up on his doorstep, plunging him into a mire of murder and subterfuge. Starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Anthony Green, George Irving and Louise Delamere.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Maverick British rifleman Richard Sharpe is promoted for saving General Wellesley's life, and sent behind enemy lines to rally Spanish support. Surrounded by the French, he manages to pull off an inspiring propaganda coup in the small town of Torrecastro. Swashbuckling adventure, featuring Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes and starring Sean Bean and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: New plumber Harry joins the gang and promptly declares Oz to be the most important person he has ever encountered - a Falklands veteran who has been to Nashville and met Country star Merle Haggard. Jimmy Nail stars, with a guest appearance by Kevin Lloyd (The Bill).

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Fraser calls off his goons and agrees to let the Magnificent Seven stay in the manor house rent-free, while Oz encounters a lady who is keen to make the most of his company. Morag Hood guest stars, with Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When Graham King's wife Shirley is murdered in an explosion that almost claims Peregrine too, the investigation heats up and exposes a maze of fraudulent activity.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The chairman of the Classic Car Restoration Society is found dead alongside his beloved El Dorado with a lungful of gasoline. The investigators try to determine whether his fate was due to a petrol siphoning accident or something more deliberate. They also wonder whether it was linked to an unidentified dead body found in his garage the day before. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When Brackenreid leaves Toronto to help an old friend find a missing woman, he learns he's a lot closer to the case than he thought.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam and the rest of the CID unit get to work in an effort to prove Gene's innocence when he becomes a suspect in a murder case. But as the investigation continues, further evidence is stacked up against Hunt, leading to a conclusion that rocks the very foundations of the detective's already fragile world. John Simm and Philip Glenister star.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam questions the ethics behind the team's methods when their attempts to catch a murderer lead to some inevitable problems, but a private meeting with Morgan leads to revelations that turn the detective's world upside down - and offer him a chance to go home. Last-ever episode of the fantasy drama, starring John Simm and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: The chalk-and-cheese detective duo are called to a private clinic where a wealthy patient has been killed. However, their investigation is made all the more difficult by the complex relationships of the victim's former fellow residents. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia take the lead roles in the second of two mystery dramas, with an all-star supporting cast including Caroline Catz, Hugh Dennis, Michele Dotrice, Freddie Fox, Suzanne Packer and Joanna Scanlan.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's helping out at an understaffed veterinary clinic. In fact, he's at the supermarket, where Fizz is trying to sell his cleaning products..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind. But never one to let a setback knock his confidence, he decides to build his own caravan and sets off in search of the perfect 'quiet spot'. All would be well if he'd only not built the caravan out of Mrs. Wicket's garden she.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Grandpa Max's engineer buddy Phil Billings gifts Team Tennyson the Omni-Copter, a state of the art flying vehicle.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis accidentally lures an unwelcomed guest into the hotel.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by singer Jack Savoretti, who chats and performs. Chefs Richard Bertinet and Nisha Katona also drop by, along with pie-maker extraordinaire Calum Franklin.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up pastaball marinara - their take on meatballs in tomato sauce - baked banana French toast topped with berry compote, crispy chilli tofu and special fried rice, and peanut butter and jelly chocolate brownies. Their guest is chef Meriel Armitage, who prepares barbecue glazed jackfruit ribs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a cleverly designed family garden that's full of fun for pre-school tots without being a primary-coloured plastic eyesore for the grownups who share it. Alan, David Domoney, Katie Rushworth and Frances Tophill also give tips on creating a mini-maze, creative sandpits and how to use plants to give an adventurous exotic flavour to play areas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for Â£400,000 after a fierce bidding war - and hours later, its former owner is tortured and killed. When a Hogson work is then stolen, Barnaby and Jones research the Midsomer painter with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms. They soon uncover evidence of forgery - but the killer is still at large. Guest starring David Bamber and Susannah Harker, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Goldfinger (1964)
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to investigate a notorious German gold smuggler and discovers his quarry has ambitions much greater than first suspected. Pursuing the criminal mastermind around the world, Bond uncovers the villain's audacious scheme to destroy the global economy with a daring attack on Fort Knox. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Gert Frobe and Honor Blackman.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: A special edition of the game show in which host Stephen Mulhern invites comedy pairings to take place. Inside No 9 stars Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn of Red Dwarf fame and Nina Wadia and Lynda Baron, who co-star in Still Open All Hours, are the famous duos taking part. As usual they try to guess the popular phrases in the hope of scoring enough points to win a cash prize for their charity of choice - and making it through to the Super Catchphrase to play for Â£50,000

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous star and travel presenter Joanna Lumley joins the boys as Star Guest Announcer, while Fleur East surprises another lucky viewer by turning up on their doorstep to offer them a Place on the Plane, ahead of the season-ending spectacular at Walt Disney World in Florida. Stephen Mulhern hosts a surprise stunt at a mystery location in London, and the Men in Brown continue on their intergalactic quest to find out which celebrity has The Squits. Plus, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the opening Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live Semi-Final. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for their place on their coach's team.

programme.title: American Gangster (2007)
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucas's empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scott's fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin.

programme.desc: From Adele and Beyonce to Will.I.Am and Zayn, these are the 21st Century's most terrifically talented popstars. But who will be declared the ultimate act on Planet Pop?.

programme.desc: Join Yinka Bokinni as she and pop icon Anne-Marie hit the salon to talk all things music, collabs and style, while getting an A-list mani from celebrity nail artist, Tinu Bello.

programme.desc: Remember these tracks? If not let us refresh your memory as we trawl through our archives to bring you our faves from the 00s.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the gravity-defying 'magic' behind Pisa's leaning tower. Plus, the making of chocolate digestive biscuits.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi prepares for a showdown with transport police in South Australia. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo take on one of their toughest jobs yet on one of Australia's worst roads.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Orange County Coppers is commissioned to create a bowling-themed bike, and the team enjoys a trip to the local lanes.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A modified 1965 Chevrolet Impala nicknamed 'Night Prowler' looks cool, but is impossible to drive. A 1967 Corvette arrives with a massive list of repairs that needs to be completed.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe gets his hands dirty once again, taking an unflinching look at the unsung American worker, and the unusual but vital vocations that keep the country running.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: External Hard Drives/Frozen Shrimp/Thai Rice Boxes/Paper Towels
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the production processes of external hard drives, frozen shrimp, Thai rice boxes and paper towels are explained.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how tea, roof finials, artificial flowers and alloy wheels are either made or processed.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the Time Bandit celebrates Christmas, but the festivities are interrupted by an unhinged deckhand going on the rampage. Jake Anderson awaits the birth of his baby.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A machine with 588 sharp teeth helps keep the coldest airport in America running. Plus, mighty tugboats chew through ice chunks in Alaska.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags an American classic, Chevrolet Corvette Stingray - but it has only been part-restored, so it is up to mechanic Edd China to complete the job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Cadillac coupe with minimal rust and damage. However, the interior is a different story meaning Edd China faces a challenge to turn a profit on its renovation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a part-restored Camaro in California with its fair share of problems. Can he and Edd work their magic and make a profit on the project?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China sets Mike Brewer the task of finding him a classic American truck. Mike heads to Sonoma County where he meets his first hipster and her Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide to create an eye-catching, inexpensive beach cruiser, as they aim to restore a classic Chevy Corvair to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China struggle to agree on the definition of a real sports car, prompting Mike to head out in search of the perfect example - bringing home a 1968 Corvette.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: After tracking Hitler's attempts to return to power through wealthy supporters in Argentina and Brazil, the investigators hits the ground in South America. An FBI report places Hitler in Colombia after unloading from a plane. Bob and John identify the marsh where they believe this aircraft was hidden, and gain access to use side-scan sonar to locate what could be the Nazi plane that shuttled Hitler to within 2,000 miles of the United States.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts investigates Harry Houdini's illusions, revealing the secrets behind his death-defying torture escape stunt.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: India's Monkey Man Monster: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: An investigation into the 2001 sightings of a strange monkey-like creature in New Delhi, which attacked residents and leapt from rooftops.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Old partners Aaron Grotjahn and Col Duff reunite on a prospecting mission. Meanwhile, the Tunnel Rats race to protect their claim as rival miners close in.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead try to arouse the passion of the Saab enthusiast community by restoring a rusty, non-driving 1973 Saab 96 to its past glory.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms, revealing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When other businesses move with the times, Drew Pritchard sees a chance to buy their unwanted stuff. In Essex, he finds a rare 1930s desk from a closing department store.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Wigan Athletic, Hull City v Charlton Athletic, and Reading v Stoke City.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Award-winning actor Neil Morrissey is reunited with a British classic, then drag races one of America's greatest cars and revisits a famous luxury saloon.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Comedian Vic Reeves meets a car that is part aeroplane. He also cruises along in a car fit for royalty and takes the wheel of a British sports iconic vehicle.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The case of Sabrina Kouider, the ex-girlfriend of Boyzone founder Mark Walton who was jailed for life for the murder of a French nanny.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A case from New Jersey in which a woman disappeared without a trace. Police trailed her husband and searched for a box of contents thay may prove his guilt.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of murderer Stacey Castor, who killed both her husbands before trying to end her daughter's life.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of a family of five in Beason, Illinois, in September 2009. Armed robber Chris Harris was later convicted of killing Rick and Ruth Gee and three of their children.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A look at the Organised Drug Enforcement Task Force's investigation into the heroin and cocaine operations of Chicago street gang El Rukn.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Ruthie and Kelly fight the heat on a roof with temperatures of more than 150F to save four kittens. Mark rescues an abandoned Chihuahua whose hind legs were crushed by a car.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown tends to Honey the dog, who has jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat. Plus, Tasmanian devils fight a mysterious illness, and a koala losing its sight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather brings her three bridesmaids to the store, Meredith has no idea what style she is looking for and Isabel is accompanied by her fiance and fashion guru.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Amy Purdy isn't afraid to take risks, such as waiting to find her dress just three weeks before the big day. Plus, Lori's wedding is just nine days ahead.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not Afraid to Try New Things
programme.desc: Excited wedding planner Rachel tries on some 'edgy' dresses. Natalie wants a unique gown, but knows her traditionally minded mother may not approve. Kleinfeld employee Subrina hopes her customised dress will match her vision.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown turns his attention to an amorous rabbit, a malnourished platypus and a pet that has escaped multiple times.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is visited by Mr Wilson the shar-pei puppy, Martha the alligator, Cheeky the bird and Polar the samoyed - a snow coloured Siberian dog.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lisa's struggle with her weight began as a child and worsened after witnessing her brother's murder. Now bedridden, she is unable to care for herself.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lisa's struggle with her weight began as a child and worsened after witnessing her brother's murder. Now bedridden, she is unable to care for herself.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing in at almost 700lbs, 50-year-old Pauline has an addiction to food that is slowly killing her and destroying her son's life as her carer. Can she get back on track?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At just 24, Bettie Jo is housebound and reliant on her husband for even her most basic needs. Now, she does her best to shed the pounds.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Illinois high school student Lee Cutler, who went missing in October 2007 after failing to turn up at his part-time job at a music shop. His locked car was found almost 200 miles away containing clothes, a backpack, and blankets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The grooms take over the salon and the consultants know that when 'the man' is in the salon, he is the one who could be driving the appointment. All of which guarantees them an interesting shift.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Davone arrives with high expectations, former cheerleader Carrie seeks the right dress, having returned a previous purchase, and military bride Jennifer has her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Christy wants a dress that will cover a scar and brings along her twin brothers to help choose, while Cathy arrives with her best men.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sahar visits the salon with one wedding dress in mind, while Kristin returns for her fitting, but it is not the same outfit she originally bought.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sonya wants an expensive look on a budget, while Candice is getting married for a second time and seeks a dress to represent who she is now.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah visits the salon with her family, but her sister's opinion is the most important, while Bethany searches for a dress that goes against her mother's wishes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Comora hunts for a glamorous gown with the help of a celebrity consultant, and Randy tries to find two dresses to satisfy a customer with expensive taste.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Norah is shopping with her family, while the consultants search for a gown for a bride with a fashion savvy entourage.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo gives readings to comedian Rosie O'Donnell, Oscar-winning actress Mo'Nique, and Mike & Molly star Billy Gardell..

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa gives a reading for Parks and Recreation star Jim O'Heir and Kim Zolciak-Biermann and Kroy Biermann of reality show Don't Be Tardy.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: We're Gonna Need a Bigger Boat
programme.desc: Ken's hoarding has taken its toll on his relationship with Lauren, but she is giving him one last chance to tackle the problem.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: The morning of his wedding anniversary, Mike Williams went duck hunting. However, when he failed to return home, an all-out search was launched. This was the beginning of a mystery that took almost two decades to solve after his murdered body was recovered 17 years later.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of Oklahoma teenagers Sarah Edmondson and Ben Darras, who decided to take the road trip from hell in March 1995. Their crimes were random, senseless and without remorse. Darras shot and killed businessman William Savage in Mississippi and Edmondson seriously wounded store clerk Patsy Byers in Louisiana.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: After Kay Weden found her 77-year-old mother Catherine Miller shot dead in her home, investigators discovered the frozen remains of her boyfriend in the Blue Ridge Mountains. When investigators spoke with Kay, they realised that she was being stalked.
